verses.roman:
eka ślokera artha yadi kara nija-mukhe
śuni' saba loka tabe pāiba baḍa-sukhe

synonyms: eka—one; ślokera—of a verse; artha—the meaning; yadi—if; kara—you do; nija-mukhe—by your own mouth; śuni'-hearing; saba—all; loka—persons; tabe—thereafter; pāiba—we shall get; baḍa-sukhe—with great happiness.
translation: "But if you explain the meaning of one verse, we can all hear it from your own mouth and thus be very happy."
